tool_description: Organizes main arguments and supporting evidence into logical sequences that build persuasive power throughout the speech.

primary_argument.description: Main thesis or central argument of the speech

evidence_types.description: Available evidence: statistics, examples, expert testimony, analogies, case studies

argument_strategy.description: Logical approach: inductive, deductive, comparative, eliminative

error_messages: Weak primary argument: Ensure the main argument is clear and defensible
Insufficient supporting points: Provide at least 2-3 supporting arguments
Invalid evidence types: Use only [statistics, examples, expert testimony, analogies, case studies]
Invalid argument strategy: Must be one of [inductive, deductive, comparative, eliminative]
Logical inconsistency: Supporting points don't align with the primary argument
usage: Provide primary argument, supporting points array, and evidence types. Optionally include counterarguments and specify argument strategy for optimal logical flow.

argument_sequence.description: Ordered sequence of arguments for maximum impact

evidence_placement.description: Where to place each type of evidence

logical_connections.description: How arguments connect and build upon each other
